page.title: 07Old Peoples Bungalows
page.content: Old Peoples Bungalows were built in the village in 1962. There are 22 units and 25 tenants at the moment. A warden visits the old people every day. She collects their pensions from the post office and does errands for them. There is a community room for meetings and social functions. The District Council built the bungalows. There are links with the Area Health Authority. Villagers are invited to their bingo sessions. The school invites the old people to social functions. Each bungalow has its own little garden. The old people all have televisions.
